summary:
Belarus is a country in Eastern Europe, with Minsk as its capital. It borders Russia, Ukraine, Poland, Lithuania, and Latvia. The nation has a rich history, with various powers ruling it over the centuries, including the Russian Empire and the Soviet Union. Belarus gained independence in 1991 after the Soviet Union dissolved.

Alexander Lukashenko has been the president since 1994, leading an authoritarian government. Belarus is known for its strong ties with Russia and its unique position as the last European country to use capital punishment. It is a member of the United Nations and several regional organizations.
title: Belarus
